title: Introduction to Web Development
content:
# Introduction to Web Development

Web development is the work involved in developing a website for the Internet or an intranet. Web development can range from developing a simple single static page of plain text to complex web applications, electronic businesses, and social network services.

## Frontend Development

Frontend development deals with the visual aspects of a website - the part that users interact with.

* HTML for structure
* CSS for styling
* JavaScript for interactivity

## Backend Development

Backend development focuses on databases, server configuration, and application logic.

* Node.js
* Python
* Ruby
* Java

## Development Frameworks

Frameworks help developers build applications faster and with better structure.

| Framework | Type | Popular For |
| --- | --- | --- |
| React | Frontend | Component-based UI |
| Angular | Frontend | Enterprise applications |
| Vue | Frontend | Progressive framework |
| Express | Backend | Minimalist Node.js framework |
| Django | Backend | Python web framework |

## Key Web Development Concepts

### Responsive Design

Responsive web design makes web pages render well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes. ___Content adaption___ is a key principle of responsive design.

### Web Accessibility

Web accessibility means that websites, tools, and technologies are designed so that people with disabilities can use them. Everyone should be able to:

* Perceive, understand, navigate, and interact with the Web
* Contribute to the Web

### Performance Optimization

Performance optimization involves making websites load faster and run smoother. This includes:

[x] Minimizing HTTP requests
[x] Optimizing images
[x] Implementing caching strategies
[ ] Using content delivery networks (CDNs)

## Getting Started

To get started with web development, you should first learn the basics of HTML and CSS. These are the building blocks of the web.

![HTML Code Example](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1461749280684-dccba630e2f6)

Next, you should learn JavaScript to add interactivity to your websites. After that, you can explore frameworks and backend technologies based on your interests and project requirements.
